entry.title: Ukraine: Guterres says â€˜Enough is Enoughâ€™ as war reaches the three-year mark
entry.summary: Monday marks three years since Russia launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine, in clear violation of the UN Charter and international law, and the UN Secretary-General has renewed his call for de-escalation and an end to the conflict.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Ukraine three years on: Pain, loss, solidarity and hope for a better future
entry.summary: 24 February 2025 marks the third year of the full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine, and the civilian population continues to face near daily-attacks. The UN staff living alongside them, enduring the same difficult conditions, have been a lifeline throughout the war.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: New round of polio vaccinations begins in Gaza
entry.summary: The latest round of a large-scale polio vaccination campaign in Gaza targeting nearly 600,000 young children got underway on Saturday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: UN in Ukraine prepares for the worst, hopes for the best
entry.summary: As the full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine reaches its third year, a flurry of diplomatic activity has led to a growing expectation of a ceasefire, although the situation remains extremely fluid. Despite the uncertainty, the UN is planning how to best support the country when the fighting finally stops.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.summary: Every day, almostÂ one in five young women are married off while still children, according to the UN reproductive and sexual health agency, UNFPA, which is urging countries to say â€œI donâ€™tâ€ to child marriage, an illegal practice that is almost universally condemned and yet remains widespread globally.

Colombia: Fleeing the thunder of violence in Catatumbo
entry.summary: Around 80,000 people in northeastern Colombia are suffering the devastating consequences of an armed conflict that escalated on 15 January of this year. Caught in the crossfire between armed groups, thousands have been forced to flee with nothing but the clothes on their backs while others remain trapped in their homes.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Security Council urges Rwanda to stop supporting M23 in eastern DR Congo
entry.summary: The UN Security Council unanimously adopted a resolution on Friday that strongly condemned the ongoing offensive by M23 rebels in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC).

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Gaza: Nearly 148,000 receive cash aid since ceasefire began
entry.summary: Aid operations in the Gaza Strip continue to reach people from north to south with critical assistance, including cash, the UN humanitarian affairs office, OCHA, said on Friday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: DR Congo crisis: Occupation blocks UN mission from protecting civilians
entry.summary: The continued occupation of North Kivu in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) by the M23 armed group has â€œseverely constrainedâ€ the UN stabilisation forceâ€™s ability to protect civilians and carry out lifesaving operations, the mission chief Bintou Keita told reporters on Friday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Urgent appeal launched as DR Congo crisis fuels mass displacement to Burundi
entry.summary: The UN refugee agency, UNHCR, has launched a $40.4 million appeal to address the deepening humanitarian crisis in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and its impact on neighbouring countries, particularly Burundi, where thousands are arriving daily in desperate conditions.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.summary: In the nearly three years since the full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine, the countryâ€™s people have endured continuous attacks, â€œpsychological terrorâ€¦displacement and hardshipâ€, top UN aid coordinator Matthias Schmale said on Friday.

entry.title: âœš Making of Defense Against Dishonest Charts
entry.summary: I published an interactive guide on reading charts, spotting the misleading ones, and visualizing data honestly. Here's the process I used to get there. Tags: behind the scenes, defense

entry.title: Acknowledgments
entry.summary: This report is a collaborative effort based on the input and analysis of the following individuals: Research team Jocelyn Kiley, Director, Political ResearchHannah Hartig, Senior ResearcherBaxter Oliphant, Senior ResearcherGabe Borelli, Research AssociateAndrew Daniller, Research AssociateAndy Cerda, Research AnalystJoseph Copeland, Research AnalystTed Van Green, Research Analyst Shanay Gracia, Research Assistant Communications and editorial Nida Asheer, Senior [â€¦] The post Acknowledgments appeared first on Pew Research Center.

entry.title: Methodology
entry.summary: The American Trends Panel survey methodology Overview Data in this report comes from Wave 161 of the American Trends Panel (ATP), Pew Research Centerâ€™s nationally representative panel of randomly selected U.S. adults. The survey was conducted from Jan. 27 to Feb. 2, 2025. A total of 5,086 panelists responded out of 5,699 who were sampled, [â€¦] The post Methodology appeared first on Pew Research Center.

entry.title: Americans Continue to View Several Economic Issues as Top National Problems
entry.summary: At the start of President Donald Trumpâ€™s second term, Americans see a host of economic issues, including inflation, as top problems facing the country. The post Americans Continue to View Several Economic Issues as Top National Problems appeared first on Pew Research Center.

entry.title: New childrenâ€™s book promotes the value of all languages
entry.summary: Language is one of the distinctive features that makes us human, and a new book supported by the UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) aims to encourage children to reflect on its importance.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Post-war order facing â€˜greatest test since its creationâ€™: UN relief chief
entry.summary: The international system set up among the ashes of the Second World WarÂ which established the United Nations and other multilateral institutions is now facing the â€œgreatest test since its creation,â€ the UN Emergency Relief CoordinatorÂ said on Thursday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: UNDP calls for long-term investment to support recovery in Syria
entry.summary: Accelerating economic recovery is critical to reverse Syriaâ€™s decline and restore stability, the UN Development Programme (UNDP) said in a report published on Thursday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: UN chief condemns â€˜abhorrent and appallingâ€™ treatment of hostagesâ€™ remains by Hamas
entry.summary: The UN Secretary-General on Thursday condemned the â€œparadingâ€ of coffins earlier in the day containing the bodies of dead Israeli hostages by their Hamas captors, describing the manner of the handover in Gaza as abhorrent.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: From suits to social justice: Worldâ€™s top human rights forum turns stage over
entry.summary: The iconic multi-hue ceilinged UN Human Rights Council chamber in Geneva got a generational make-over when it turned the venue over to young artists and changemakers in a lively celebration of social justice.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Central African Republic faces ongoing challenges ahead of elections
entry.summary: The recent attack on a UN patrol in the Central African Republic (CAR) which resulted in the death of a Tunisian peacekeeper, underlines the constant dangers facing peacekeepers from armed groups there, theÂ head of the UN mission (MINUSCA) told the Security Council on Thursday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: DR Congo violence has pushed 35,000 to Burundi, says UN refugee agency
entry.summary: Escalating violence in eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) has continued to uproot thousands more people to neighbouring countries where they face dire conditions without many basic necessities, UN humanitarians said on Thursday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: What Our Sources Taught Us About Reporting Responsibly on Homelessness
entry.summary: Homelessness is at a record high, and there are many investigative stories to tell. ProPublica has compiled tips and lessons learned from its sources while pursuing its coverage.
